title: Kirsten Dunst to replace Elisabeth Moss in Netflix film after Handmaid's Tale scheduling conflict
text:
Kirsten Dunst has had quite a year, with a new Showtime series and a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

Now she's swooping in to save the day on a Netflix film from writer/director Jane Campion.

Dunst has replaced actress Elisabeth Moss in the film The Power of the Dog, which is set to premiere in 2021.

Casting announcement: Kirsten Dunst has replaced actress Elisabeth Moss in the film The Power of the Dog, which is set to premiere in 2021 on Netflix

The film stars Paul Dano and Benedict Cumberbatch as two wealthy brothers who own the largest ranch in the Montana valley.

Thoughtful and gentle, Dano's character secretly marries a local widow, the role now portrayed by Dunst.

When Cumberbatch's brilliant, yet cruel character finds out, he sets out to destroy her using her son as a pawn.

Moss previously dropped out of the film, as it conflicts with production on the fourth season of Handmaid's Tale.

Rich family: The film stars Paul Dano and Benedict Cumberbatch as two wealthy brothers who own the largest ranch in the Montana valley

Sibling rivalry: Thoughtful and gentle, Dano's character secretly marries a local widow, the role now portrayed by Dunst. When Cumberbatch's brilliant, yet cruel character finds out, he sets out to destroy her, using her son as a pawn

Scheduling conflicts: Moss previously dropped out of the film, as it conflicts with production on the fourth season of Handmaid's Tale

Dunst most recently starred in Showtime's new series On Becoming A God In Central Florida.

She played a minimum wage-earning mother in 1990s Florida who goes after a pyramid scheme after her husband dies on the job.

The dark comedy, which also stars Alexander Skarsgård, was recently renewed for a second season.

Leading lady: Dunst most recently starred in Showtime's new series On Becoming a God in Central Florida

She's a star: She was also honored in August with a coveted star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame

Dunst was also honored in August with a coveted star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

The 37-year-old recently made fans' dreams come true when she sparked interest in a Bring It On sequel.

She said on The Kelly Clarkson Show: 'If they wanted to make another movie, I would make another movie. Why not? It would be so fun.'
description: The film stars Paul Dano and Benedict Cumberbatch as two wealthy brothers. Dano's character secretly marries a local widow, portrayed by Dunst, sparking a feud with his brother.
